question: Your are stayig at your friend’s house who is travelling to another country. A recent strom damaged the house. Write a letter to your friend and say What happened and whenWhat was damaged in the houseWhat needs to be done about it
text: How’s the trip going? I’m just writing to let you know something that happened earlier this week.

I don’t want you to panic but there was a huge storm last Monday. That storm damaged the front yard’s trees, and due to this, the roots of these trees were come out from the land and fall off. Before you jump out of the flight, I just assure you that there is nothing serious.

Thankfully, most of the branches were blown off at the other side of the house, but one of them crashed through the front door and damaged the front side window a little bit. Due to this, the whole glass of that window was shattered, and I got hurt as well.

I called the emergency service straight away, and incredibly, they were there in just one hour. As I called them on time, they patched  everything up on time, and they asked me to call the insurance company, which I did. As you are the owner of this house, so they want to speak with you directly about your loss compensation.
Hope that this doesn’t interfere with your rest. And I finally assured you that there is all under control from my end.
